About Me

Student Researcher with a passion for the fields of Deep Learning & Quantum Computing. Currently the Head of Research, AI & Quantum Computing at Next Tech Lab and Vice-Chairperson of ACM Student chapter at SRM IST.
I am proficient with :

  • Python 3.x and its common associtated libraries (numpy, pandas, matplotlib, django)
  • Tensorflow, cirq and their combinational library Tensorflow Quantum.
  • I also have some experience with deploying models using tensorflow.js

I aim to purse a masters degree in Computer Science with a focus on Quantum Machine Learning.


Experience

MYELIN FOUNDRY

www.myelinfoundry.com

Machine Learning Intern

June 2019 – July 2019

Bangalore, India |

Letter Of Recommendation

Tensorflow PyTorch ESPNet Kaldi Tensorflow.js

Myelin Foundry is a deep tech product start-up that transforms human experiences and industry outcomes by building Artificial Intelligence algorithms on video, voice, and sensor data, for edge devices.

As an intern in my 2nd year, I worked on a NLP based project which focused on the Pashto and Urdu languages.  In particular, working with Pashto was quite a challenge as there was very small footprint of data available for train/test and yet the model had to be built which had to deliver a high level of accuracy, easy for inferencing and also be language agnostic to minimise language specific rebuilds of the model.

Additionally, I worked on other project to evaluate models in Tensorflow.js for deployment. I was also given the task to help set up the on-site GPU server for ssh use.

SAMSUNG

www.samsung.com

Research Partner PRISM

November 2019 – Present

Chennai, India

Tensorflow Bezier Curves BERT NLTK

Samsung is a South Korean multinational conglomerate headquartered in Samsung Town, Seoul. It comprises numerous affiliated businesses, most of them united under the Samsung brand, and is the largest South Korean chaebol.

As part of a team of student researcher under the Samsung PRISM program, I worked on Online Handwritting Recognition in Bengali and Tamil. The dataset was collected by us on campus and comprised of 1300 Handwritting samples. The data was in the form of XML Files with (x,y,t) information.

The model we chose to use was an attention based LSTM to learn more information. This model was combined with a pre-trained language model - BERT to improve the accuracy of our predictions. currently working on testing and modifying the model architecture.

Head of Research, AI & Quantum Computing

August 2018 – Present

Chennai, India

Interview by College

We believe everyone has the capacity to be creative. Next Tech Lab is a place where people use design to develop their own creative potential . Yes, we need to come up with a better mission statement.

As the Head of Research at our college's premier research lab, I am incharge of mentoring our students, conducting interviews for new recruits, managing research budgets. These are on top of the research projects that I undertake myself. I also take part of all administrative duties of the lab such as : approval of equipment & managing partnerships with other organizations.

I pioneered Quantum Computing Research at the Next Tech Lab. My work here was acknowledged by my university and for my work I was interviewed by them.

ASSOCIATION OF COMPUTING MACHINERY

https://www.facebook.com/SRMACM/

Vice Chairperson, Student Chapter

January 2019 – Present

Chennai, India

Certificate of Service

The Association for Computing Machinery is a US-based international learned society for computing. It is the world's largest scientific and educational computing society. The ACM is a non-profit professional membership group, claiming nearly 100,000 student and professional members as of 2019

As Vice Chairperson of our college's ACM Student Chapter, I am incharge of conducting interviews for new recruits , managing events. I am tasked administrative duties such as : approval of equipment, managing partnerships with other organizations, approving events & get sponsorships.

I served as the secretary here till Jan 2020. My work here was acknowledged by ACM Global and I was sent a letter of appreciation. Under my term, our team grew from 18 people to 250 people. The growth was accompanied by a growth in our number of events.
